Smart Parking

system wykrywania zajętości miejsc parkingowych

About the project

The smart car park project aimed to detect occupied parking spaces in the underground car park (as in shopping malls). The information about the occupancy was supposed to help the employees of the office to find a parking space. The system consists of modules suspended above the parking place and a HUB that collects data from individual modules. In the other hand, the module consists of an ultrasonic sensor and a processor STM32 F103, which sends cyclically data via a CAN interface to the HUB about its current state. Data from all modules are sent to Backend, where they are then presented to the user. The communication is also provided in both directions, i.e. it is possible to configure the modules using an provided API.

Upper part of the parking module

Each module is assigned an ID that corresponds to the place where it hangs. The IDs are stored in flash memory, so that after a power failure they will not be removed.

Mounted parking module

The modules are mounted on the ceiling in the underground car park.

Picture of a part of the functioning system

The modules indicate the occupied space by means of an LED so that you can see from a distance whether the space is occupied or free.

By Mateusz Janus
